TopicTitle: [1.1.3] (2016-07-24) Telemachus - Telemetry and Flight Control in the Web Browser

Articles.Content:
On 21/06/2017 at 8:19 PM, drtedastro said:

something like below.  it has always been needed to be able to see where we will be in 3, 5 or n orbits.??

 

I have actually posted the result of my development based on telemachus in a different topic:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/162249-analog-gauges-and-ground-tracks/

I think one the output is matching quite well what you are talking about.

I didn't use kerbal map though because the different zoom level didn't allow to have the map on full screen with a black background and I had difficulties to manage the overlay accurately with the ground tracks.

I instead use maps stored locally (could be stored online as well of course).

My next step was actually to see how I could manage a zoom function, but I haven't started looking at it.

many thanks for the info.

Checking it out now.

Cheers.

Hi guys,

Has anyone else encountered an issue where they were unable to rightclick the telemachus antennae? The mod seems to install perfectly fine, and I can place it on my ship in the VAB but cannot right click it either in the VAB or while in flight. I have seen this problem earlier in the thread but it was not acknowledged.

Thanks in advance!

I run telemachus in partless mode, so i don't use the antenna. Maybe you could use partless mode and eliminate the need for the antenna? I know it doesn't really address your question but maybe it's a feasible workaround.
I compiled the code against KSP 1.3, both 32 and 64 bit and on both right clicking is working fine. Which version are you using?

Thanks for the quick response..

1.3 I believe (just updated the game last night). I've got a few mods installed alongside it, RPM, KER, Hullcam, Vesselview, KJR, and a couple of cosmetic mods.

 

Edit: Partless might be exactly what I'm looking for. I found the link on Github, but I'm a little unsure how to install it. Any tips?

Edited June 30, 2017 by QQuMADbrah

To use partless mode, just edit the config file, it's GameData/Telemachus/Plugins/PluginData/Telemachus/config.xml

Just change the line to 

<int name="PARTLESS">1</int>

Awesome, found it, only issue is, it's already set to that.

If it's already set up, how do I start using telemachus? Normally I would right-click an start a link, is this now done automatically when I start a flight?
yeah it should just work with whatever vessel you're flying.
I gave partless a shot, no go. I launched a vessel then went to the URL given by the user manual, and it said it could not connect. I don't think the telemachus server ever started. Any ideas?

make sure you're trying to connect on the right port on the right machine

make sure your firewall isn't blocking it

I posted a release a freshly compiled version (https://github.com/mikelikes/Telemachus/releases/tag/v1.5.2-ksp1.3). I made no code changes to the existing project, and didn't test this through! But maybe it helps you get Telemachus running on your machine.

Also, try to use Telemachus on a fresh install to check whether the problem really is with the mod.

yeah what AntiSol said...

Any time after I do an initial install of Telemachus, I always open my browser on the same PC as KSP, and test everything using 127.0.0.1:8080... If that works, THEN I will try connecting with a browser on a different machine on my network using the proper address/port... Doing it this way pretty much narrows down issues to either the mod itself, or network/firewall issues/settings...

Hey guys!

Just got back from a long weekend (HBD Canada!) and downloaded the file above... everything is working gravy now! Not sure if that's what fixed it, but just wanted to let you know we are good to go! Cheers
Anyone know where I can get a patch to make Telemechus interface with RSS/RO and Real Fuels?
It is not supported by this mod unfortunately...
Another question does anyone here know how to use NGROK to port forward the Telemachus page?
I'm also having trouble getting it to work over the internet, I've tried port forwarding every combination of public and private IP and it doesn't seem to work on PC's not on my network.
Great mod, now all I need are some friends
is there any chance that it could in the next update feature a downrage distance setting like mechjebs?

I'm wanting to connect it to my kindle fire for a navball. I'm presuming the navball is streamed?
Nav ball does not seem to be. But maybe one could be made if pitch role heading could be read and made into a ball program. I would like to try to get it to go into voiceattack
